elements.title: Leeds 2023 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a seven-metre-tall (23 ft) "sculptural forest" (pictured) was created during Leeds 2023, inspired by the region's ancient woodland?

elements.title: John Blair (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Scottish surgeon John Blair was the only dux of his high school to receive his gold medal in the presence of his wife and child?

elements.title: Time Still Turns the Pages (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 2023 drama film Time Still Turns the Pages won the Audience Choice Award at the 60th Golden Horse Awards?

elements.title: New World Department Store (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the abandoned New World Department Store in Bangkok became home to thousands of fish?

elements.title: Tan Kue Kim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Singaporean chef and restaurateur Tan Kue Kim cooked while wearing a S$40,000 gold Rolex watch?

elements.title: arguing about whether a beer promotional calendar was "demonic" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that online social and "Barstool conservatives" spent their Christmas holidays arguing about whether a beer promotional calendar was "demonic"?

elements.title: Majella O'Donnell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as she commenced chemotherapy, Irish singer Majella O'Donnell raised more than €350,000 for the Irish Cancer Society with a sponsored head shave live on The Late Late Show?

elements.title: Mystic, South Dakota (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that US president Calvin Coolidge left Mystic, South Dakota, in a lumber wagon?
